amendment.description: To express the sense of the Senate that Medicaid administrative regulations should not undermine Medicaid's role in our Nation's health care system, cap Federal Medicaid spending, or otherwise shift Medicaid cost burdens to State or local governments and their taxpayers and health providers, or undermine the Federal guarantee of health insurance coverage Medicaid provides.

vote.text: Amendment SA 4333 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Amendment SA 4333 proposed by Senator Conrad for Senator Baucus. (consideration: CR 3/14/2008 S2078-2080; text: CR 3/14/2008 S2079-2080) To express the sense of the Senate that Medicaid administrative regulations should not undermine Medicaid's role in our Nation's health care system, cap Federal Medicaid spending, or otherwise shift Medicaid cost burdens to State or local governments and their taxpayers and health providers, or undermine the Federal guarantee of health insurance coverage Medicaid provides.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 4333 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 4333 proposed by Senator Conrad for Senator Baucus.
